ranked_diseases.explanation: Classic triad of thymic aplasia/hypoplasia, hypoparathyroidism, and T-cell immunodeficiency due to 22q11.2 deletion. All three major features are present.
Can present with DiGeorge-like features including hypoparathyroidism and T-cell deficiency, though less common than 22q11.2 deletion.
Can include thymic hypoplasia and immune deficiency, though hypoparathyroidism is less typical. CHD7 mutations cause this syndrome.
Peroxisomal disorder that can rarely present with thymic hypoplasia and endocrine abnormalities, though the full triad is uncommon.
Rare syndrome with hypoparathyroidism and immune deficiency, though specific thymic involvement is less well characterized.
HDR syndrome (Hypoparathyroidism, Deafness, Renal disease) can have immune abnormalities, though thymic aplasia is not typical.
